body:
i'm thankful that it is raining, even though that means i can't go for a run, since it means i have a little time to write thank you notes.

i'm thankful that miso eventually peed in the rain when i took her out first thing in the morning. i'm thankful that it was not raining so hard that it soaked the thick warm bathrobe i wear as a top when taking her out in the morning.

i'm thankful that since d taught her to lay down, when miso gets stubborn on a walk and doesn't want to go any further, she lays down, which even when it is annoying because we need to get back from the walk is also slightly hilarious, especially in circumstances (like the grass being covered in frost, or on rough asphalt) where i think laying down is not super comfortable and she seems to do it more gingerly.

i'm thankful that d's cold seems to be getting better, even though she is still having awful coughing fits. i'm thankful that i did not catch the cold. i'm thankful that i too would like to have the kind of life where i could only be described by [this adjective](https://twitter.com/caityweaver/status/1055263490192084993).

i'm thankful for how when [kacey musgraves is writing a song](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/24/arts/music/kacey-musgraves-slow-burn.html), she writes the chorus in the middle of a sheet of paper and then adds the verses on post-its around it. 

i'm thankful that we are catching up on this season of _insecure_, which is good even though it stresses me out to watch shows about characters who are broke, since that's a big anxiety of mine (even though i am not broke now). i'm thankful, though, to have art representing that instead of fictional worlds full of secret improbable millionaires (i'm also thankful for the soundtrack). i'm thankful for _the name of the wind_, which similarly feels like harry potter if harry potter was broke, which is kind of great.

i'm thankful it's friday.
